name: Jurys Inn London Chelsea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Jurys Inn Chelsea for a week in October 2010. The hotel is clean with an inviting lobby that has a breakfast restaurant and a bar. Our room wasn't large, but it was quite adequate with a queen size bed, desk/chair, additional chair, TV. Very nice size bathroom with shower/tub combo. The staff tried really hard to be helpful and some were excellent but some lacked either language skills or basic knowledge of the city. It is a 2-minute walk to the overground train, and about 10-15 minutes to the tube, so a little far from main attractions, but it was quiet and relaxing (except for one morning breakfast when we were overrun by a choir staying at the hotel!). The food was acceptable; our room included full breakfast, which was the usual: eggs, ham, tomatoes, beans, plus toast, rolls, fruit, cereal. Same every day. Expensive wireless and only available in lobby. Bring an extension cord. The plugs are not well located. You have to put your room key into a little box inside the room to make the lights work (most travelers probably know this, but I didn't!). Slight concern about security as hotel almost put someone else in our room at 2:30 in the a.m. and freely gave us additional room keys without requesting ID. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good value, nice service, off the beaten path

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had been worried by other comments re location. However Imperial Wharf overground literally a few mins away.We checked out in the morning and they looked after our luggage..Managed to get back there ,pick up luggage and be back on train in 10 mins..Providing you time it right and read time tables a fab position.Lovely pub by the Thames with sandwiches etc and outside area and blankets(( smokers)closed early on Sun night thogh.We walked to South Ken and museums from hotel. Very interesting and only about 1/2 hour stroll.Rooms clean and big.We were 6th floor and althogh opposite lift didnt worry but I can understand that it may.Good breakfast (but a bit slow) and nice bar.
reviews.title: Was worried by other traveling but no probs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently spent one night at the Jurys Inn, Chelsea, having booked it as part of a British Airways flight+hotel package for a one night stay in London from my home on Jersey, Channel Islands. Several hotels were offered (many of them part of a well-known chain) as part of this package and I read the reviews of all of them tripadvisor before deciding on Jurys Inn. This was because, despite the positive descriptions of all the hotels on the BA website, many of the reviews on tripadvisor were less than complimentary! The only negative reviews regarding the Jurys Inn, however, concerned its location - and I thought I could live with that!
reviews.title: A bit out of the way, but a great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is true that the location is not very convenient if you want shops nearby because it is situated in the middle of what is a still-under-development area close to the river in Chelsea called 'Imperial Wharf'. The nearest underground is Fulham Broadway - it is advertised as being a 15 minute walk away, but I admit that my partner and I did not test this out - we opted first of all for the overground train from West Brompton to Imperial Wharf (an easy connection to make, especially with an oyster card - Imperial Wharf overground station is literally a two minute walk from the hotel), and then the morning after our stay for a taxi back to West Brompton underground to save time, which came to £5. Neither travel option is that bad, and both have advantages and disadvantages, but the disadvantages are certainly not worth ignoring Jurys Inn Chelsea for!
reviews.title: Excellent - would definitely return here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once at the hotel we were warmly welcomed, and check-in was quick and efficient. There was no information given about breakfast times, but this was easily checked in the room. The room itself was spacious, the bed huge and comfortable, with spare pillows available. There was a huge flat screen TV in the room with several freeview channels available, although a written guide to which channel is which would be helpful to have in the room in addition to the general hotel information card.
reviews.title: Just as good the second time around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A stay at the Jurys Inn Chelsea was included with our British Airways tickets. Cannot complain about a free room - the hotel itself is no frills and serviceable.
reviews.title: Remote, No Frills

reviews.text: The room had a double and single bed with a desk. There were tea making facilities in the room. The bathroom was simple and clean. Soap and shampoo were provided in squirt bottles on the wall. All very functional. There is a charge for internet access.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!

reviews.text: English breakfast was included with our room. A good selection of hot and cold food and lots of fresh fruit was offerred each day. The breakfast restaurant is light and bright with large windows.
reviews.title: OK Stay

reviews.text: The major drawback was location. While the hotel is right beside the Imperial Wharf train station, service is spotty from there. The next closest station of Fulham Broadway is a spur line also with irregular service. We ended up taking a cab each time to and from Earl's Court to get regular service.
reviews.title: Good hotel, near overground station, would stay again

reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend the hotel for tourists to London because of the extra travel time, but it would be a satisfactory hotel for those with business or activities in the Chelsea area.
reviews.title: go somewhere else...

reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and two children. It is has good transport links as the Overground Station which is one minute away. It is walking distance to the Kings Road and close to the Thames Pathway. We stayed in a very spacious Laura Ashley room on the top floor which was perfect. Could not ask for more.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on an Alfa holiday and after reading the reviews were a liitle concerned about the hotel and it's distance from the centre of London. However we needn't have worried. We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. The room was quite spacious for two and had everything you would expect, tea & coffee, toiletries etc. The breakfast was very good. We found the staff to be pleasant and efficient.
reviews.title: Better than expected.

reviews.text: Imperial Wharf station is 5 minutes away, take the train to West Brompton and it's easy to get to Londons' main attractions from here. We bought day tickets for £7 and you can use them on trains, buses and the underground, you even get a 1/3 off river cruises.
reviews.title: A nice hotel and its location is all right for getting into London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual the Alfa holiday was excellent and well organised.
reviews.title: The jury is in - it is out!

reviews.text: A nice no frills hotel, everything was clean and the check in, service and food were very good. If you don't want to use the train, there is an excellent bus service for getting into Central London.
reviews.title: nice hotel and quite reasonable

reviews.text: A basic hotel albeit with a London price tag. Imagine a Holiday Inn Express with an irish accent and a real bath instead of just a shower.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Express with an Irish accent

reviews.text: Built amongst the glamorous Chelsea Marina development I trudged a mile from the nearest tube station (Fulham Broadway) only to find that it has a railway station right next to it (Imperial Wharf) that links into the underground system. Unless you have business in the Chelsea Fulham area though it does seem a long way from anywhere else.
reviews.title: Well located, basic hotel
Overbooked - transferred to Croydon!!!
reviews.text: After checking in with a credit card I was told later in the bar and restaurant that I wasn't creditworthy and had to pay cash which didn't do much to endear the establishment to me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel whilst on business in September 2010. The hotel is well located with good train connections and secure independent parking across the road. The staff are friendly and accomodating. The rooms are quite basic and the one I stayed in was not very clean. There were stains on the carpet and it did not look as if it had been vacumed properly. The bathroom was also quite tired. The hotel does not look very old but the rooms need refurbishing. On balance I probably wouldn't choose to stay again especially given the choice of hotels in London.
reviews.title: A good basic hotel, great location

reviews.text: I can't actually review this hotel as I was unable to stay there. When I booked, I told them I would be arriving late and was assured that my room was confirmed for late arrival (this was written on my confirmation). We arrived at midnight and there was no rooms left (they already had our money). We were told that it was a breakdown of the booking system. Other people had been called that day and the previous day and had the chance to cancel and book elsewhere. However, I had phoned that morning to confirm my late arrival again and was told that there was no problem. At midnight, we were put in a taxi and sent to Croydon. The Croydon hotel was fine (the area not so great) but not exactly handy for Wimbledon which was why we booked Chelsea - it took the taxi 1 hour and 5 minutes to get back to Chelsea in the traffic the next morning. The hotel paid for the taxis but we got no reply from them to any of the emails we sent.
reviews.title: Great value

description: We have one of the finest London hotels, near Victoria and Fulham Broadway station, and with Imperial Wharf Station just opposite the hotel in Chelsea, your city-centre stay will enable you to get-around effortlessly, and there’s no better place to come back to after a wearying day taking in the sights of a world-class capital. Rest your feet: you’re home at Jurys Inn.Our spacious bedrooms include large, comfortable beds with crisp white linens, large screen TV’s, WiFi Internet access and spacious bathrooms with complimentary toiletries.Our rooms can accommodate three adults, two adults and two children or just one person in complete comfort, making Jurys Inn Chelsea the perfect hotel for a business trip or a city break.
